title: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil projected to topple Joker at the box office with $45 million
text:
It is still three days out from hitting theaters all across the world.

But the buzz behind Angelina Jolie's new film Maleficent: Mistress of Evil has the dark fantasy adventure on track to topple Joker for the number one spot at the box office with about $45 million in its opening weekend, according to Variety.

The sequel, which is Disney's live action spin-off of Sleeping Beauty, features a cast that includes returnees Elle Fanning, Sam Riley, Imelda Staunton, Juno Temple, and Lesley Manville and newcomers Michelle Pfeiffer, Ed Skrein and Chiwetel Ejoifor.

Bug buzz: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil is projected to topple Joker for the top spot at the box office with $45 million in its opening weekend, according to Variety

Despite the optimistic projection, the Maleficent sequel is still pacing behind the original 2014 film, which raked-in $69 million in its opening weekend, making it the largest opening-weekend performance for a live-action film starring Jolie.

It went on to become a bonafide box office hit, earning more than $758 million worldwide.

This weekend's projection has Joker and the new movie Zombieland: Double Tap competing for second place, with both predicted to make somewhere between $20 million and $30 million.

Joker, starring Joaquin Phoenix in the iconic role, has been tops at the box office, raking in more than $200 million domestically in 11 days.

Top dog: Joker has been tops at the boxing office, earning more than $200 million domestically in just 11 days

Star power: The Maleficent sequel, which is Disney's live action spin-off of Sleeping Beauty, features a cast that includes returnees Jolie, Elle Fanning and Sam Riley

The Maleficent sequel is also opening this weekend at all of the major international markets.

The promo push ahead of the this weekend's release included premieres in Rome, London, Moscow, along with the big September 30 showing in Hollywood.

According to Deadline, it's being projected to do between $115 million to $125 million worldwide in the coming days.

Despite the optimistic projection, the Maleficent sequel is still pacing behind the original 2014 film, which raked-in $69 million in its opening weekend; Michelle Pfeiffer joins the cast that also includes newcomers Ed Skrein and Chiwetel Ejoifor

Set five years after the first film, Maleficent's (Jolie) peaceful life as the protector of the Moors takes an unexpected turn when Prince Phillip (Harris Dickinson) proposes to Princess Aurora (Fanning) and she accepts.

Unbeknownst to all, Phillip's mother, Queen Ingrith (Pfeiffer), plans to use the wedding to divide humans and fairies forever. With Maleficent and Aurora finding themselves on opposite sides of an impending war, the two question whether they can truly be a family.

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil hits theaters in US October 18.
description: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil  is projected to topple Joker for top spot at the weekend box office with $45 million, according to Variety.
